The Golden Gate Bridge is approximately 122 feet wide, including its sidewalks. The main traffic area spans about 90 feet and is divided into six lanes, each roughly 15 feet wide. A baker's dozen consists of 13 Mac Trucks. If these trucks were lined up side by side, each taking up about 10 feet, they would require 130 feet of space. Since this exceeds the bridge's total width of 122 feet, the trucks would not fit and would likely cause a traffic jam.
